  • There is concern about the decline in the quality of Indian players emerging from the domestic circuit.

ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy - The Indian Express
summary:
ExplainSpeaking: What the latest GDP estimates tell about the state of India’s economy

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: Indian Express

The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) has released the First Advance Estimates (FAEs) of India’s GDP growth for the financial year 2024-25. These estimates suggest that India's nominal GDP is projected to reach Rs 324 lakh crores, growing 9.7% over the previous financial year.

  • The estimated nominal GDP for FY25 is $3.8 trillion at the exchange rate of 85 rupees to a dollar.
  • Real GDP is expected to be Rs 184.9 lakh crores, accounting for 57% of nominal GDP, indicating a growth deceleration.
  • Private consumption demand (PFCE) plays a crucial role, contributing almost 60% to GDP.
  • Government spending growth has been slow, averaging just 4.2% for the current year.
  • Investments have stalled since 2014, leading to reduced productive capacity growth.
"When one considers a slightly longer period, it becomes clear that India’s real economy is growing at less than 5% per annum."

The latest GDP figures serve as a reality check, revealing that while India's growth appears strong, much of this is boosted by a low base effect from the pandemic's economic contraction.
newTitle: India's Economic Outlook: Insights from the Latest GDP Estimates

title: Students’ body, teachers question new UGC draft regulation on faculty appointments - The Hindu
summary:
Students’ body, teachers question new UGC draft regulation on faculty appointments

Date: January 07, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The Left-leaning Students’ Federation of India (SFI) has rejected the newly released Draft University Grants Commission (UGC) regulations, describing it as an attempt to centralize and corporatize educational institutions.

  • The SFI argues that the draft gives Governors a greater role in appointing Vice-Chancellors, making the selection process opaque.
  • It allows for industry experts to be considered for Vice-Chancellor roles, which the SFI claims dilutes academic quality.
  • Concerns were raised about the shift from research focus to reinforcing existing knowledge, potentially increasing workload for teachers.
“It is quite evident that the process of short-listing candidates for interview and final selection is very opaque: there’s no clarity about whoever will be called.” - SFI Leaders Mayukh Biswas and V.P. Sanu

This draft regulation has sparked a debate on the direction of higher education in India, with various stakeholders voicing their concerns over the implications for academic integrity and quality of education.
newTitle: Students’ body, teachers question new UGC draft regulation on faculty appointments

title: Eyewitness video captures destruction after powerful earthquake rocks Tibet - Hindustan Times
summary:
Eyewitness Video Captures Destruction After Powerful Earthquake Rocks Tibet

Date: Jan 07, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

A powerful earthquake measuring 6.8 struck near Tibet's holiest cities, killing 126 people and destroying several homes. Eyewitness videos shared by Reuters depict the destruction and chaos following the quake.

  • The earthquake's epicentre was 80 km (50 miles) north of Mount Everest.
  • Tremors were felt in Nepal, Bhutan, and India.
  • Rescue teams are currently searching through rubble for trapped individuals.
  • The Dalai Lama expressed his sadness over the event and offered prayers for the victims.
  • Many buildings, particularly older homes, suffered significant damage.
"I offer my prayers for those who have lost their lives and extend my wishes for a swift recovery to all who have been injured." - Dalai Lama

The earthquake has raised concerns over future safety and preparedness in the region.
newTitle: Eyewitness Video Shows Aftermath of Tibet Earthquake

  • Previous controversies involving BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri have escalated tensions between the parties.
  • Atishi claims the BJP has wrongfully cancelled her official residence allotment.

Veena George says no need to worry about HMPV infection - The Hindu
summary:
Veena George says no need to worry about HMPV infection

Date: January 07, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Health Minister Veena George reassured the public that there is no need for panic regarding the Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV), stating that most circulating information is false and that the virus has been previously detected in the state.

  • George reported that the Institute of Advanced Virology has detected 11 cases of HMPV in 2023 and 2024.
  • She advised precautions for vulnerable populations including those with low immunity, pregnant women, and the elderly.
  • The Minister emphasized wearing masks in crowded areas but noted no travel restrictions are in place.
  • George inaugurated various development projects at Thrissur Government Medical College Hospital, including a substation and new health facilities.
  • The Minister also launched renovations at the Mundathikode Family Health Centre.
“The claim that it is being reported for the first time in the country is completely false.” - Veena George

The public is encouraged to remain calm and informed as health authorities monitor the situation closely.
newTitle: Veena George addresses concerns over HMPV infection, emphasizes public safety

  • Gunshots fired outside Khan’s residence in April 2024, leading to increased security measures.

title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO: Issue subscribed 15.86 times on day 1; check details here | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Quadrant Future Tek IPO: Issue subscribed 15.86 times on day 1; check details here

Publication Date: January 7, 2025; Source: Live Mint

The initial public offering (IPO) of Quadrant Future Tek opened for subscription today, January 7, and saw exceptional interest, being subscribed over 15.86 times on the first day.

  • The IPO received bids for 9,18,47,850 shares against the offered 57,99,999 equity shares.
  • The price band for the shares is set between ₹275-290.
  • Retail and Non-Institutional portions were significantly oversubscribed at 54.84 times and 21.51 times, respectively.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyer portion received only 0.05 times subscription.
  • The company aims to raise ₹290 crore from this fresh issue.
  • Notable anchor investors included Citigroup, Capri Global, and various mutual funds.

Link Intime India Private Limited is the official registrar, while Sundae Capital Advisors acts as the lead manager for the public issue.

“Quadrant is a research-oriented company engaged in developing new generation Train Control and Signalling Systems for Indian Railways.”

This IPO marks a significant step for Quadrant Future Tek as it seeks to enhance operational capabilities and expand its market presence.
newTitle: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Subscribed 15.86 Times on Day 1

title: Temasek nears deal to buy 10% stake in Haldiram at $10 billion valuation - Business Standard
summary:
Temasek Set to Acquire 10% Stake in Haldiram Valued at $10 Billion

Publication Date: Recent Report
Source: Moneycontrol

After prolonged negotiations, Singapore’s Temasek is nearing a deal for a 10% stake in Haldiram Snacks Foods, valued at $10 billion, from the Agrawal family.

  • Temasek has signed a term sheet with Haldiram's promoters.
  • The deal is considered one of the largest in India, pending due diligence.
  • Temasek's investment plans in India are extensive, with aims to invest $10 billion by 2027.
  • Haldiram Snacks reported significant revenue growth, with FY23 revenues reaching ₹6,375 crore.
  • Future plans include a potential listing of the company within a year.
“Temasek plans to invest $10 billion in India by 2027, bringing its total exposure in the country to $47 billion.”

This prospective deal illustrates the tremendous growth potential for Haldiram Snacks and reflects Temasek's confidence in India's market landscape.
newTitle: Temasek Set to Acquire 10% Stake in Haldiram Valued at $10 Billion

title: Aamir Khan takes 'Mannat' to quit smoking if Junaid Khan’s film 'Loveyapa' gets its success - TOI Etimes
summary:

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Aamir Khan has vowed to quit smoking if his son Junaid Khan’s upcoming romantic comedy 'Loveyapa' becomes a success. The film is generating buzz, and Aamir's commitment showcases his support for Junaid.

  • Junaid Khan is set to star in 'Loveyapa' alongside Khushi Kapoor.
  • The romantic comedy features themes relevant to modern life, including technology's impact on relationships.
  • Aamir Khan praised the performances in the film and likened Khushi's energy to her mother, Sridevi.

Aamir Khan on the film: "I liked this film, it is very entertaining... All the actors have done a good job."

Overall, Aamir Khan's gesture not only highlights his bond with his son but also generates interest in 'Loveyapa', setting it up as a potential box-office success.
newTitle: Aamir Khan's Promise to Quit Smoking for Son Junaid's Film Success
